revised_title: The Removal of Micro-organisms from Water: Experiments with Various Filtration Materials
tldr: The author conducted experiments to discover the effectiveness of various filtration materials in removing microorganisms from water. They tested greensand, silver sand, powdered glass, brickdust, coke, animal charcoal, and spongy iron. The results showed that spongy iron and animal charcoal were the most effective in removing microorganisms from water, while coke and brickdust also demonstrated significant filtering powers.
